```{r, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# Load necessary libraries
suppressPackageStartupMessages({
  library(tibble)
  library(dplyr)
  library(plotly)
  library(DT)
  library(Gviz)
  library(htmltools)
})
metrics <- params$metrics
sample_gtf_df <- params$sample_gtf_df
reference_gtf_df <- params$reference_gtf_df
associated_genes_list <- params$associated_genes_list
TP <- params$TP; PTP <- params$PTP; FN <- params$FN; FP <- params$FP
non_redundant_sensitivity <- params$non_redundant_sensitivity
non_redundant_precision <- params$non_redundant_precision
redundant_precision <- params$redundant_precision
positive_detection_rate <- params$positive_detection_rate
false_discovery_rate <- params$false_discovery_rate
redundancy <- params$redundancy
output_directory <- params$output_directory
genome_assembly <- params$genome_assembly
sample_gtf_df$gene_id <- sub("\\.\\d+$", "", sample_gtf_df$gene_id)

# Ensure that the images are accessible
plots_dir <- file.path(output_directory, "igv_plots")
```

## Summary {.tabset .tabset-fade}

### Data Matrix

```{r echo=FALSE}
data_matrix <- tibble(
  Category = c("True Positive (TP)", "Partial True Positive (PTP)", "False Negative (FN)", "False Positive (FP)"),
  Value = c(nrow(TP), nrow(PTP), nrow(FN), nrow(FP)),
  Description = c(
    "TUSCO transcripts accurately detected as Reference Matches (RMs), representing perfect identification of known TUSCO genes.",
    "TUSCO transcripts identified as Full Splice Match (FSM) or Incomplete Splice Match (ISM) for a TUSCO gene but lacking RM qualification due to minor differences in transcript start or end positions.",
    "TUSCO genes with no SQANTI3 transcripts detected (no isoforms matched to the TUSCO gene).",
    "TUSCO transcripts classified as Novel In Catalog (NIC), Novel Not in Catalog (NNC), Genic Intron, or fusion transcripts, potentially arising from sequencing artifacts, transcript model reconstruction artifacts, or biological transcript deviations."
  )
)

# Display Data Matrix Table with Improved Aesthetic and Left-Aligned Text
datatable(
  data = data_matrix,
  options = list(
    pageLength = 5,
    autoWidth = TRUE,
    dom = 't',
    columnDefs = list(list(className = 'dt-left', targets = "_all"))  # Left alignment for better readability
  ),
  caption = htmltools::tags$caption(
    style = 'caption-side: bottom; text-align: center; font-style: italic;',
    'Table 1: Summary of TUSCO classification metrics used in the evaluation.'
  )
) %>%
  formatStyle(
    columns = 'Value',
    fontWeight = 'bold',
    color = '#000080'
  )
```

::: {style="border-left: 3px solid #ccc; padding-left: 15px; margin-right: 10px; font-size: 14px; font-family: Arial; color: #333; line-height: 1.6;"}

**Reference Match (RM):** Isoform is FSM and within 50 bp of annotated transcription start and end sites.

**Full Splice Match (FSM):** Isoform with identical exon count and matching internal junctions; start and end may vary.

**Incomplete Splice Match (ISM):** Isoform missing some 5' exons but with matching internal junctions.

**Novel In Catalog (NIC):** Isoform uses known splice sites but lacks FSM or ISM match.

**Novel Not in Catalog (NNC):** Isoform contains unannotated splice sites.

**Genic Intron:** Isoform entirely within an annotated intron.

:::

### Evaluation Metrics

```{r echo=FALSE}
datatable(
  metrics,
  options = list(
    pageLength = nrow(metrics),
    autoWidth = TRUE
  ),
  caption = htmltools::tags$caption(
    style = 'caption-side: bottom; text-align: center;',
    htmltools::em('Table 2: Evaluation metrics of TUSCO classification.')
  )
)
```

::: {style="border-left: 3px solid #ccc; padding: 10px 15px; margin-right: 10px; font-size: 14px; font-family: Arial; color: #333; line-height: 1.6;"}

#### 1. Sensitivity (Sn):

\[ \text{Sn} = \frac{\text{Unique (TP)}}{\text{Total TUSCO Genes}} \]

#### 2. Non-redundant Precision (nrPre):

\[ \text{nrPre} = \frac{\text{TP}}{\text{Total TUSCO Match Transcripts}} \]

#### 3. Precision (Pre):

\[ \text{Pre} = \frac{\text{TP} + \text{PTP}}{\text{Total TUSCO Match Transcripts}} \]

#### 4. Positive Detection Rate (PDR):

\[ \text{PDR} = \frac{\text{Unique (TP + PTP)}}{\text{Total TUSCO Genes}} \]

#### 5. False Discovery Rate (FDR):

\[ \text{FDR} = \frac{\text{Total TUSCO Match Transcripts} - \text{TP}}{\text{Total TUSCO Match Transcripts}} \]

#### 6. False Detection Rate:

\[ \text{False Detection Rate} = \frac{\text{FP}}{\text{Total TUSCO Match Transcripts}} \]

#### 7. Redundancy (1/Red):

\[ \text{Redundancy (1/Red)} = \frac{\text{TP + PTP}}{\text{Unique (TP + PTP)}} \]

:::

## Benchmarking Result {.tabset .tabset-fade}

### Radar Plot

```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE}
# Calculate the metrics values (raw numerics)
metrics_values <- c(
  non_redundant_sensitivity * 100,
  non_redundant_precision * 100,
  1 / redundancy * 100,           # Inverse redundancy as in the plot
  100 - false_discovery_rate * 100,
  positive_detection_rate * 100,
  redundant_precision * 100
)

# Replace NA/Inf with 0 to avoid plot failures
metrics_values[is.na(metrics_values) | is.infinite(metrics_values)] <- 0

# Create labels for the metrics
metrics_labels <- c("Sn", "nrPre", "1/red", "1-FDR", "PDR", "rPre")

# Close the radar plot by appending the first metric and label to the end
metrics_values <- c(metrics_values, metrics_values[1])
metrics_labels <- c(metrics_labels, metrics_labels[1])

# Create interactive radar plot using plotly
interactive_radar_plot <- plot_ly(
  type = 'scatterpolar',
  r = metrics_values,
  theta = metrics_labels,
  fill = 'toself',
  mode = 'lines+markers',
  marker = list(
    color = '#1f77b4',
    size = 8,
    line = list(color = '#1f77b4', width = 2)
  ),
  fillcolor = 'rgba(31, 119, 180, 0.3)',  # Soft, semi-transparent blue fill
  line = list(width = 3, color = '#1f77b4')  # Explicitly set the line color to blue
) %>%
  layout(
    polar = list(
      radialaxis = list(
        visible = TRUE,
        range = c(0, 100),
        tickvals = seq(0, 100, 25),
        tickfont = list(size = 14),  # Larger tick font for readability
        gridcolor = 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1)',  # Subtle grid lines
        linecolor = 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2)'    # Light axis line color
      ),
      angularaxis = list(
        tickfont = list(size = 14),  # Larger font for metric labels
        linewidth = 2,
        color = '#333333'            # Darker label color for contrast
      )
    ),
    margin = list(l = 20, r = 20, b = 80, t = 20),  # Increased bottom margin if needed
    paper_bgcolor = 'rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)',       # Transparent background
    plot_bgcolor = 'rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)',
    showlegend = FALSE,
    title = list(
      font = list(size = 18, color = '#333333'),
      x = 0.5
    ),
    annotations = list(
      list(
        x = 0.5,
        y = -0.1,  # Adjusted position within visible range
        text = "<span style='font-style:italic; color:grey;'> Figure 1: Radar plot illustrating the evaluation metrics of the TUSCO benchmarking result. </span>",
        showarrow = FALSE,
        xref = "paper",
        yref = "paper",
        xanchor = "center",
        yanchor = "top",
        arrowhead = 2,
        arrowsize = 1,
        font = list(color = "grey", size = 12)
      )
    )
  ) %>%
  # Add hover tooltips for precise metric values
  add_trace(
    hoverinfo = 'text',
    text = paste(metrics_labels, ':', round(metrics_values, 2), '%')
  )

# Display the plot
interactive_radar_plot
```

## Decision Matrix {.tabset .tabset-fade}

### TP

```{r echo=FALSE, eval=(nrow(TP) > 0)}
# Extract unique genes with available plots
TP_genes_with_plots <- TP %>%
  filter(file.exists(file.path(plots_dir, paste0(associated_gene, '.png')))) %>%
  pull(associated_gene) %>%
  unique()

# Add only buttons to the dataframe (no modal HTML in each row)
TP <- TP %>%
  mutate(
    Plot = ifelse(
      file.exists(file.path(plots_dir, paste0(associated_gene, '.png'))),
      paste0('<button class="open-modal" data-modal="modal_tp_', associated_gene, '">View Plot</button>'),
      'No Plot Available'
    )
  )

# Generate modal HTML once per unique gene
TP_modals_html <- sapply(TP_genes_with_plots, function(gene) {
  paste0(
    '<div id="modal_tp_', gene, '" class="modal plot-modal">
      <div class="modal-content">
        <span class="close-modal" data-modal="modal_tp_', gene, '">&times;</span>
        <img src="', file.path('igv_plots', paste0(gene, '.png')), '" alt="Plot for ', gene, '" style="width:100%;height:auto;">
      </div>
    </div>'
  )
}) %>% paste(collapse = "\n")

# Display the table with the Plot column
datatable(
  data = TP,
  extensions = 'Buttons',
  escape = FALSE,  # Allow HTML rendering in the table
  options = list(
    dom = 'Bfrtip',
    buttons = c('copy', 'csv', 'excel'),
    autoWidth = TRUE,
    scrollX = TRUE,
    columnDefs = list(
      list(className = 'dt-left', targets = "_all"),
      list(whiteSpace = 'normal', targets = "_all")
    )
  ),
  caption = htmltools::tags$caption(
    style = 'caption-side: bottom; text-align: center; font-style: italic;',
    'Table 3: Classification metrics used in the evaluation of TP.'
  )
)

# Render modals outside the table (one per unique gene)
htmltools::HTML(TP_modals_html)
```
